name: Zorin OS
description: A user-friendly, secure, and powerful alternative to Windows and macOS, designed to make your computer faster and more reliable.

name: Linux Mint
description: An elegant and comfortable operating system that is both powerful and easy to use, providing a classic desktop experience.

name: elementary OS
description: A fast and open replacement for Windows and macOS, with a focus on thoughtful design and a pay-what-you-can model.

name: Ubuntu
description: One of the most popular Linux distributions, offering a secure, stable, and customizable environment for desktops, servers, and IoT devices.

name: Puppy Linux
description: A collection of lightweight Linux distributions that are fast, easy to use, and ideal for older or less powerful hardware.

name: Ubuntu Studio
description: A multimedia content creation-oriented version of Ubuntu, pre-loaded with a suite of audio, video, and graphics applications.

name: Debian
description: A stable and reliable free operating system that is the foundation for many other Linux distributions.

name: Raspberry Pi OS
description: The official operating system for the Raspberry Pi, optimized for performance and including a suite of educational tools.

name: FreeBSD
description: A powerful and versatile operating system known for its advanced networking, security, and storage features.

name: Arch Linux
description: A lightweight and flexible Linux distribution for proficient users who value simplicity and a do-it-yourself approach.
